entry.title: R Weekly 2024-W43 tidyHeatmap, test titles, reshape
entry.summary:
Hello and welcome to this new issue! How to have (my) content shared by R Weekly? This weekâ€™s release was curated by Jonathan Carroll, with help from the RWeekly team members and contributors. Highlight Exploring the tidyHeatmap R package Donâ€™t Expect That â€œFunction Works Correctlyâ€, Do This Instead Comparing data.table reshape to duckdb and polars Insights R and Python consoles + JupyterLite in www.techtonique.net Gradient-Boosting anything (alert: high performance): Part2, R version Highlights from Shiny in Production (2024) Positron in action with #TidyTuesday orca encounters Monads in R Authenticate with Alpaca API Comparison of spatial patterns in continuous raster data for overlapping regions using R
How to Loop Through Column Names in Base R with Examples How to Add Suffix to Columâ€¦

entry.title: Brandon Johnson Gives Away the Store to the Chicago Teachers Union
entry.summary: An act of corrupt self-dealing notable even in the history of a city famous for it.

entry.title: Yes, Kamala Harris Wants You Out of Your Gas-Powered Car
entry.summary: Whatever Harris is saying to Michiganders, the administration is indeed telling you that your choice in cars is going to be artificially constrained.

entry.title: Time for a Humble Federal Reserve
entry.summary: The last thing the Fed should want is to be caught as flat-footed as it was in 2008.

entry.title: How the Courts Can Make Both the President and Congress Stronger
entry.summary: Effective presidents must work with Congress rather than go it alone. Fortunately, the courts have begun to encourage such cooperation.

entry.title: R Weekly 2024-W41 Generative Art, Word Templates, Expectations
entry.summary:
Hello and welcome to this new issue! How to have (my) content shared by R Weekly? This weekâ€™s release was curated by Colin Fay, with help from the R Weekly team members and contributors. Highlight Getting started with generative art 3MW (Using Word Templates With R) Expectations, Verified! Dive into the World of Unit Tests with expect_*() Insights Using property-based testing in R R in the Real World Examining exams using Rasch models and assessment of measurement invariance R in Organizations A Guide to R Package Validation in Pharma What is GxP Validation in Clinical Software Development? Dive into the World of Unit Tests with expect_*() A Safe Space for Learning How to Make Pull Requests Economic Calendar Getting started with generative art How to Split Data into Equal Sized Groups in R: A Comprehensive Guide for Beginners Mastering Data Manipulation in R: Comprehensive Guide to Stacking Data Frame Columns 3MW (Using Word Templates With R)

entry.summary: Until Americaâ€™s public schools can reliably educate, every single kid in this country deserves an alternative.

entry.summary:
Hello and welcome to this new issue! How to have (my) content shared by R Weekly? This weekâ€™s release was curated by Tony ElHabr, with help from the R Weekly team members and contributors. Highlight Data Career Insights: Lessons from four senior leaders in the data space In-Place Modifications Reproducible data science with Nix, part 13 â€“ {rix} is on CRAN! Insights Cover and modify, some tips for R package development Data Career Insights: Lessons from four senior leaders in the data space RStudio IDE and Posit Workbench 2024.09.0: Whatâ€™s New Reproducible data science with Nix, part 13 â€“ {rix} is on CRAN! Some Options for Fast Matrix Decompositions in R

entry.title: Ding Dong, Nasrallah Is Dead
entry.summary: The devastating blows Israel has meted out against an organization that has American blood on its hands should be celebrated.

entry.title: We Must Break the Cycle of Pandering
entry.summary: Voters deserve major-party candidates who treat them like grown-ups, telling them the truth rather than what they want to hear.
